channel.title: East Lansing Michigan on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in East Lansing Michigan on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: WKAR-TV television spectrum may be up for sale, and the station is at risk
item.description:
Michigan State University is considering placing the spectrum that it uses for WKAR-TV into an auction that the FCC is running, in which case it might receive upwards of $200 million in exchange for ceasing all of its terrestrial broadcasts.

This strikes me as a penny wise, pound foolish approach. Once the spectrum is gone you can’t get it back, and as a land grant institution should know it’s important to be a good steward of the resources you have been handed not just for the short term but for the long term. Selling off a 50+ year tradition of public broadcasting for a quick buck seems like a bad approach, no matter how appealing a big check would be, especially considering the community’s investment in the station.

I don’t currently have a TV receiver for over the air broadcasts, but my neighbor down the street who does make the trek from Ann Arbor to Lansing to give her thoughts. Her family grew up on WKAR-TV and have been supporters for years, and they rely on over the air television to bring in the signal.

More as I have it; I’m collecting links and news articles at the Lansing Localwiki, at the WKAR-TV page.

item.title: Unrest in the streets of Columbus and East Lansing after Michigan State beats Ohio State to win Big 10 football
item.description:
Both Columbus, Ohio and East Lansing, Michigan are reporting unrest in the streets after the football victory by the Spartans over the Buckeyes.

To listen in:

  • Columbus Ohio Police Dispatch
  • Ingham County Michigan Public Safety

I'm looking for news stories from both areas. Twitter is moving fastest; it's hard to tell stories straight from the scanner.

East Lansing

From East Lansing, a series of couch fires, reported on by the State News and the Detroit News.

Chair burning on corner of Spartan and Frye pic.twitter.com/UdsOkqJ0Mw

— The State News (@thesnews) December 8, 2013

For on the ground reports about couch burning and riots in east Lansing following #msu win tonight, follow @katieabdilla

— David Jesse (@Freephighered) December 8, 2013

Cedar Village, right now https://t.co/gzPJ7ebC6g

— Omari (@omarisankofa) December 8, 2013

Columbus, Ohio

From Columbus, the inimitable Dead Schembechlers, and reports of fires:

in other news someone lit a couch on fire on 14th

— Lynn Lipps (@LynnLipps) December 8, 2013

"Oh, OSU! Why do you weep for National Championships? The only thing that matters to the soul is the defeat of Michigan." ~ Bo Biafra

— DeadSchembechlers (@BoBiafra) December 8, 2013
